label: Bible (Proverbs to Apocalypse)

metadata.label: Call Number
metadata.value: Takamiya MS 104 (Request the physical item to view in our reading room)

metadata.label: Abstract
metadata.value: Manuscript, on parchment, of the books of the Bible from Proverbs through the Apocalypse.

metadata.label: Rights
metadata.value: More about permissions and copyright. The use of this image may be subject to the copyright law of the United States (Title 17, United States Code) or to site license or other rights management terms and conditions. The person using the image is liable for any infringement.

description: Ex libris Ronald A. Coates; Eric Millar; Brian S. Cron. From the collection of Toshiyuki Takamiya, 2013-. With an Oxford pledge note for the Selton Loan Chest dated 1469 and the mark of the stationer John More. There is also a note by M. Paris, possibly Master Thomas Paris of Oriel College. /n Layout: double columns of 49 lines. Script: small gothic script. Decoration: red and blue penwork initials. Binding: modern goatskin
attribution: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University
